\n Overview: \n
\n
At Essen Health Care, we care for that!
\n
\n
\n
\n
As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.
\n
\n
\n
\n
Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!
\n
Job Summary: \n
\n
Position title:
Healthcare Data Analyst\n
\n
\n
\n
Job summary
: Essen Health Care is seeking a
junior-level Analyst
with a solid foundation in data to support the Operations Manager within the Cardio Vascular Division. This on-site role is well-suited for a candidate in the early stages of their career who is comfortable with data analysis and visualization and motivated to contribute to operational performance and data-informed decision-making in a healthcare setting.\n
Responsibilities: \n
Data Collection & Management
\n
\n
Collect, clean, validate, and organize operational data from internal systems.
\n
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability across datasets and reports.
\n
Maintain structured datasets to support recurring and ad-hoc analysis.
\n
\n
Data Analysis & Reporting
\n
\n
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis to identify trends, variances, and improvement opportunities.
\n
Prepare routine and ad-hoc reports to support operational tracking and planning.
\n
Support KPI monitoring and performance analysis under the guidance of the Operations Manager.
\n
\n
Data Visualization & Insights
\n
\n
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using
Power BI
.
\n
Present data findings in a clear and structured manner.
\n
Translate data into meaningful insights that support operational and business decisions.
\n
\n
Operations & Team Support
\n
\n
Work closely with the Operations Manager on day-to-day analytical tasks and projects.
\n
Collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to understand data needs and definitions.
\n
Respond to data and reporting requests accurately and within established timelines.
\n
\n
Qualifications: \n
Required Skills & Qualifications
\n
\n
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Business, Statistics, Economics, Healthcare Administration, Data Science, Operations, or a related field.
\n
Strong foundational understanding of data concepts
, including data structures, data quality, and basic data modeling.
\n
Proficiency in
Microsoft Excel
(formulas, pivot tables, data analysis).
\n
Working knowledge of
SQL
for querying and extracting data.
\n
Experience using
Power BI
(academic, internship, or project-based experience acceptable).
\n
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
\n
High attention to detail and accuracy.
\n
Ability to clearly explain data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
\n
\n
Additional Requirements
\n
\n
Must be based in New York and able to work on-site full time.
\n
Authorized to work in the United States.
\n
\n
Preferred Qualifications
\n
\n
Internship, academic project, or early professional experience involving data analysis or reporting.
\n
Exposure to healthcare, operations, or performance analytics.
\n
Familiarity with KPIs and basic reporting frameworks.
\n
\n
\n
What We Offer
\n
\n
Entry-level opportunity with hands-on exposure to real-world operational analytics
\n
Close mentorship from operations leadership
\n
On-site, collaborative work environment within the CV Division
\n
Competitive compensation and benefits package
\n
Growth and learning opportunities in healthcare analytics
\n
Equal Opportunity Employer: \n
\n
Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.
\n
\n
